question_text: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined:One of the twins was as daring as the other was _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: Daring means to be audaciously bold or adventurous.Timid means Lack of boldness

question_text: The first time Paul met Ngozi, her beauty caught his eye. This means that _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: Because when talking about beauty, it can only attract you.

question_text: From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that has the same consonant sound(s):Strange
subject: english-language
explanation: The consonant sound is |dz| which has the same sound with logic

question_text: This question is based on S. L. Manyika's IN DEFENCE:According to Tayo the two major problems of Nigeria were.
subject: english-language
explanation: Chapter Twenty-one (21) of the book gave a narrative about how Tayo had been writing about the problems of Nigeria and how he believed that greed and mismanagement were the root causes of the problems.

question_text: The government has decided to freeze student's grants. This means that government intends to
subject: english-language
explanation: The word "freeze" stands for "stop".

question_text: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:This case is within the jurisdiction of the council.
subject: english-language
explanation: 'Jurisdiction' the italicized word in the question means the official power to make legal decision and judgement while authority, the answer, is synonymous in that it means the power or right to give orders, make decisions

question_text: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:The children received gifts from doting parents.
subject: english-language
explanation: The word doting was italicized in the question . It means to be extremely and uncritically fond to someone, to love dearly while loving means feeling or showing love and affection

question_text: Fill in the gap:The press will no longer be free when the new government starts to _____ newspapers.
subject: english-language
explanation: To officially suppress an unacceptable part of a book, film, news, etc.

question_text: In the novel "Independence" Tayo lied to Vanassa that Christine was his _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: In chapter Nine, Tayo was showing Vanessa his collection of photographs when Christines popped out and then he lied about her being his cousin.

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s):The _____ event takes place every two years.
subject: english-language
explanation: Biannual means occurring twice a year.Biennial means Takes place every two yearsÂ

question_text: Fill in the gap:Mr Collins does not allow his name to be published in connection with the philanthropy because he _________ publicity.
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s):The crops the farmer planted will be ________ in three months time.
subject: english-language
explanation: It's not possible to sell the crop that isn't harvested.

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s):Garba acquiesced _____ their decision.
subject: english-language
explanation: The preposition 'in' is used to indicate interest or feeling

question_text: Select the option that best explain the information conveyed in the sentence:The letter was being written by the principal.
subject: english-language
explanation: When the word 'being' is used in a past continuous tense, as it is in the above question, it means the action is happening sow or was happening before, in or continual manner, just like in the answer, the principal was writing the letter

options.answer: The letter had been written by the principal
The principal was writing the letter
The principal wanted to write the letter

question_text: Select the option that best explain the information conveyed in the sentence:Advising Olu to break his bad habit is like knocking your head against a brick wall.
subject: english-language
explanation: It is trying the impossibleThe idiomatic expression 'knocking your hand against a brick wall' means to attempt continuously and fruitlessly to accomplish some task or achieve some goal that is or seems ultimately hopeless, more like it is impossible

options.answer: It is making a fool of you
It is making him your enemy
It is asking him to beat you

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s): _____ a good boy, he was given a prize.
subject: english-language
explanation: "Being" can be used as a gerund, a word that acts like a noun and looks like a verb.Being is the verb, boy is the noun.

question_text: Choose the options that have the same consonant as the ones represented by the letter(s) underlined:leisure
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options.The stressed are written in capital letters:departmental
subject: english-language
explanation: de|part|MEN|tal

question_text: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:They come here on bootless errand.
subject: english-language
explanation: The word bootless means ineffectual, useless of a task or undertaking, while the answer worthwhile means worth the time, effort spentBootless explains that the errand was useless while worthwhile explains it was the effort, which is also synonymous to the word useful

question_text: Choose the option to which the given sentence relates:Aderonke STATED she had a right to her privacy.
subject: english-language

options.answer: Did Omowunmi state she had a right to her privacy?
Did Aderonke lament she had a right to her privacy?
Did Aderonke state she had a right to her openness?
did Aderonke state she had a right to his privacy

question_text: Select the option that best explain the information conveyed in the sentence:The painting was beautifully faked.
subject: english-language
explanation: The painting being beautifully faced could also be described as a good deceptive replica, which means there is almost no difference in the fake painting and the original.

options.answer: The painting was a good deceptive replica
The painting was well-framed and displayed

question_text: The number of workers have increased steadily each year means _____.
subject: english-language

question_text: From the options, choose the word nearest in meaning to the underline word:By working hard, Benjamin outshone his elder brother instead of being _____.
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:The students received a mild reproof from the teacher.
subject: english-language
explanation: This answer was chosen because it is opposite to the word italicized in the question; reproof which means an expression of criticism, blame.From the above meaning of the other options, it is obvious that non-fits for the opposite of the word 'reproof'. Commendation means an official or a formal praise

question_text: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:Aisha impelled to the party.
subject: english-language
explanation: The words 'impel and compel' are synonymous impel means drive, force or urge someone to do something while compel means force or oblige someone to do something.

question_text: When you ________ an opponent's point in a debate, you must do so politely.
subject: english-language

question_text: From the options given, choose the option that is opposite in meaning to the underlined word.:This house which was sealed off years ago has now been ________.
subject: english-language
explanation: Sealed off means to prevent people from entering a building

question_text: In the book "Independence" Tayo's uncle, Kayode, wanted to study Engineering in _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: In chapter sixteen, Tayo's uncle, Kayode, revealed to him that he was considering studying engineering at the Insitute du Petrole in France

question_text: Choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options. The stressed are written in capital letters:Judiciary
subject: english-language
explanation: |ju|DI|cia|ry|

question_text: From the options, choose the word opposite in meaning to the underlined word:He is quite an outspoken young man but his father is ________.
subject: english-language
explanation: Outspoken means to be direct and open in speech and expression.To be reserved or uncommunicative in speech and expression

question_text: In the book "Independence" Wearing woolens, lamb cardigans, extra socks, gloves and Balliol scarf signified that Tayo was _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: Clothings, gloves, cardigans and extra socks are outfits worn during winter when the temperature is low, cold

question_text: Choose the word that best completes the following sentence:I really like working in that office: I find the _____ very friendly.
subject: english-language
explanation: Means the pervading tone or mood of a place, situation, or creative work.

question_text: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word:The delegates found it better to resort to consultation rather than _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: Consultation means the action or process of formally consulting or discussing.A serious disagreement or argument

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s):The delegates were given _____ .
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the option nearest to the statement:My brother's drunkenness often got on my nerves. This means.
subject: english-language

question_text: In the Novel "Independence" Tayo wrote a biography of _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: In chapter 27, Tayo's biography of Lord Lugard became his new success

question_text: Choose the option opposite in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:The chairman is parsimonious.
subject: english-language
explanation: The word Parsimonious means very unwilling to spend money or use resources. On the other hand 'Generous is the opposite', meaning to give more of something especially moneyFrom the above meaning of each words of option, generous best describes the opposite of parsimonious, as every other option is synonymous to parsimonious

question_text: Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.Now that Michael has become rich, Nancy has begun to make much of him. This means _____.
subject: english-language

options.answer: now gets a lot of money from Michael
no longer wants to leave Michael

question_text: Tayo opted to remain in Nigeria because he had a duty to serve his
subject: english-language
explanation: In chapter 24, Tayo mentioned his student as one major reason why he wasn't open to the demand from his wife, Miriam, to leave the country

question_text: Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word or phrase in italics:This event was a watershed in the company.
subject: english-language
explanation: The question has the word watershed italicized. The word means an event or perfect marking a turning point in a situation. It is synonymous to the word landmark which means an event or discovering marking an important stage or turning point in something

question_text: Choose the best option that best completes the gap(s):Snakes and ladders always _____ me happy these days.
subject: english-language
explanation: According to the pluralia tantrums law of concord; whenever a pluralia tantrum appears, it must be followed by a singular verb. Pluralia tantrum are nouns that appear in plural forms, some of these words have finals, while some do not e.g Mathematics, economics, Darts, Snakes and ladders e.t.c.

question_text: Choose the option that has the same consonant as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined:clash
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the option that has the same consonant as the one represented by the letter(s) underlined:who
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the option to which the given sentence relates:My Boss has an amiable DISPOSITION.
subject: english-language
explanation: Still going by the rule when answering questions on emphatic stress, the option that doesn't have the emphasized word. In this case 'DISPOSITION' is the emphasized word on the only option without it is option D

options.answer: Does your boss have an amiable disposition
Does my boss have an unfriendly disposition
Does my colleague have an amiable disposition?
Does my boss have an amiable complexion?

question_text: Choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options below:palatable
subject: english-language

question_text: Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.Despite their newness on the job, the workers were remunerated rather handsomely. This means that _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: The word 'remunerate' as used in the sentence means paid for services rendered or work done, while the word 'handsomely' means to a large degree, substantially and also connotes attractiveness

options.answer: those paid were handsome in appearance
workers were paid by handsome accountants

question_text: Choose the word that is most nearly opposite in the meaning to the underlined word or group of words that will fill in the sentence.At first we found life in the town very exciting but soon it became rather _____.
subject: english-language

question_text: Suleiman's reason for becoming a Muslim in the novel is because Islam brings sense of _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: In chapter 30, Suleiman was resolute about tracing his roots and finally finding his identity amongst his people in Africa and in the religion, Islam

question_text: Select the option that best explain the information conveyed in the sentence:The man's Achilles' heel is women _____.
subject: english-language
explanation: The phase 'Achilles heel' means a small problem or weakness in a person or system that can result in failure. The phrase has it origin traced to the legend of Achilles, that tells the talk of Achilles, how he was dipped into the river styx by his mother, That is in order to make him in vulnerable. His heel wasn't covered by the water and he was later killed by a narrow wound to his heel.
